newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican reporters, guards come to blows on press day.
newsitem.headline: Mexican reporters, guards come to blows on press day.

text.p: While politicians honoured Mexico's Press Freedom Day at a lunch on Friday, security guards scuffled with reporters and blocked their entry to the event, news agency Notimex said on Saturday.
Reporters were told they could not enter the lunch, attended by about 300 newspaper owners, directors and editors, Notimex said.
Guards grabbed the blouse of one female reporter and violently shoved some photographers to keep them from entering the lunch, it said.
Candidates for Mexico City mayoral race spoke at the event to members of the Mexican Daily Newspaper Association on the importance of respecting the media.
President Ernesto Zedillo said earlier in the week he had begun an investigation to look into recent attacks by his personal military bodyguards on his press pool.
